result.execSummary:
The defendant German Herrera-Pavon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (From Vehicle, at or Toward Building or Vehicle), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(3)(a)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Court costs, victim/witness surcharges including the DNA surcharge are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 06-26-2022; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- Employment or school.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Brenda Bartholomew sworn as spanish interpreter.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 166 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/26/2022; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/26/2022; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Case in court for jury trial, jury trial is vacated and plea hearing proceeded.

Pursuant to negotiations Count 2 will be dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in Count One of the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15, bail to remain the same.

Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Batholomew.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez.

Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant submitted a guilty plea questionnaire.  The court began the guilty plea colliquy.  Conference held off the record.  The Court provided the parties with case law regarding deportation.  Clerk returned the guilty plea forms to defense counsel.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on May 12, 2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant German Herrera-Pavon not in court, in custody.  No A Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case rescheduled for Final Pretrial on 4/30/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Awni Yasin in court, defendant German Herrera-Pavon not in court, in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 4/17/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 5/12/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order sigend and filed.

Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court with attorney Awni Yasin.  Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in custody.  Kerri Puig, student intern under the supervision of Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court, in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
State Public Defender's Office was not able to appoint counsel for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CASE RECALLED DUE TO ERROR IN RECOMMENDATION BY JUSTICE POINT.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

All other conditions ordered by the Court remain the same.

Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant German Herrera-Pavon in custody.  Dax C. Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Henry Tap Tavern; Rafael HS; Erin L or Feliciano RR

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
